title.native: フリクリ プログレ

description:
Many years have passed since Naota and Haruhara Haruko shared their adventure together. Meanwhile, the war between the two entities known as Medical Mechanica and Fraternity rages across the galaxy. Enter Hidomi, a young teenaged girl who believes there is nothing amazing to expect from her average life, until one day when a new teacher named Haruko arrives at her school. Soon enough, Medical Mechanica is attacking her town and Hidomi discovers a secret within her that could save everyone, a secret that only Haruko can unlock.
But why did Haruko return to Earth? What happened to her Rickenbacker 4001 she left with Naota? And where did the human-type robot ‘Canti’ go?

(Source: Adult Swim)

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Psychosexual
tags.description: Work that involves the psychological aspects of sexual impulses.

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Feet
tags.description: Features the sexual depiction or stimulation of a character's feet.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Motorcycles
tags.description: Prominently features the use of motorcycles.

tags.name: Achromatic
tags.description: Contains animation that is primarily done in black and white.

tags.name: Real Robot
tags.description: Prominently features mechanical designs loosely influenced by real-world robotics.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

name.native: ヒドミ・アンジャクロー

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/70045461) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kmotohiro/) | [Website](https://www.motohiro.com/)

More known for his work as a director in the live action industry. Famous for Bayside Shakedown and its theatrical films. The second film in the series has grossed over ¥17.35 billion at the box office, making it the highest-grossing live-action Japanese film on domestic screens.

Since 2013, he has also been a part of [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/)'s planning department.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/y_sadamoto)

Yoshiyuki Sadamoto is an animator, illustrator, character designer, and one of the founding members of studio Gainax.

After college, Sadamoto learned the ropes of key animation under [Yasuo Otsuka](https://anilist.co/staff/136873/Yasuo--Otsuka) at Telecom before becoming a founding member of Gainax. Otsuka later named Sadamoto one of the three men more skillful than him. Though Sadamoto is not an unskilled animator by any means, his reputation rests mainly on his iconic character designs, evident in the reception of the Evangelion cast. Nearly all of Gainax' biggest productions have their characters designed by Sadamoto. He is one of the biggest contributors to the general look of Gainax anime and has proven to be massively influential for character designers of future generations.

Sadamoto's characters are often thin, fragile and have sharp yet understated facial features. He pays a lot of attention to fashion as well.

Most of Sadamoto's influences are mangaka such as [Katsuhiro Otomo](https://anilist.co/staff/96872/Katsuhiro-Otomo), [Yoshitaka Amano](https://anilist.co/staff/97967/Yoshitaka-Amano), [Kazuo Umezu](https://anilist.co/staff/97777/Kazuo-Umezu), and [Leiji Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/97597/Leiji-Matsumoto). Sadamoto would go on to author the Evangelion manga. 

Post-Gainax he has remained active as character designer, mostly for [Mamoru Hosoda](https://anilist.co/staff/100067/Mamoru-Hosoda)'s popular feature films. He has also focused on different visual and illustration works, as he worked on several manga and is co-creator and character designer for the .hack game franchise.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/2256470167)

After graduating from high school, Kubota went through training at [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/)'s research center before dropping out and joining [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/) in 1998. Three years later in he met [Sushio](https://anilist.co/staff/103619/) at Comiket, which led to Kubota joining [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/). There he made his debut as an animation director on the premiere of [Mahoromatic](https://anilist.co/anime/277/)'s second season.

In 2005, he made his debut as a character designer, although still jointly together with Sushio and [Takaaki Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/110187/), on the 6th [One Piece](https://anilist.co/anime/464/) movie. The film was directed by Mamoru Hosoda, which led to Kubota getting an invite to join the production of [The Girl Who Leapt Through Time](https://anilist.co/anime/2236/) as an animation director. After this he kept working at Gainax until going freelance.

In 2012, he worked as the main character designer on [From the New World](https://anilist.co/anime/13125/) and [Robotics;Notes](https://anilist.co/anime/13599/), and a few years later he served as one on [One-Punch Man](https://anilist.co/anime/21087/), which earned him international fame.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/binobinobi) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/押山清高)

Co-founder and Representative Director of [Studio Durian](https://anilist.co/studio/6283/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/2256470167)

After graduating from high school, Kubota went through training at [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/)'s research center before dropping out and joining [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/) in 1998. Three years later in he met [Sushio](https://anilist.co/staff/103619/) at Comiket, which led to Kubota joining [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/). There he made his debut as an animation director on the premiere of [Mahoromatic](https://anilist.co/anime/277/)'s second season.

In 2005, he made his debut as a character designer, although still jointly together with Sushio and [Takaaki Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/110187/), on the 6th [One Piece](https://anilist.co/anime/464/) movie. The film was directed by Mamoru Hosoda, which led to Kubota getting an invite to join the production of [The Girl Who Leapt Through Time](https://anilist.co/anime/2236/) as an animation director. After this he kept working at Gainax until going freelance.

In 2012, he worked as the main character designer on [From the New World](https://anilist.co/anime/13125/) and [Robotics;Notes](https://anilist.co/anime/13599/), and a few years later he served as one on [One-Punch Man](https://anilist.co/anime/21087/), which earned him international fame.

Nishio graduated from Nagoya Designer Academy and started his career at Anime Spot, a subcontracting studio, after being refused in interviews with several animation studios. He debuted as an in-betweener on [Osomatsu-kun](https://anilist.co/anime/9883/) and as a key animator on [Laughing Salesman](https://anilist.co/anime/3077/).

It's on [Yu Yu Hakusho](https://anilist.co/anime/392//) that Nishio came into his own as an animator, developing weighty and realistic movements influenced by [Satoru Utsunomiya](https://anilist.co/staff/101489/). Thanks to the ability demonstrated there, he was chosen to design the characters for [Ninku](https://anilist.co/anime/912/).

After working as character designer and chief animation director on [Jin-Roh](https://anilist.co/anime/570/) he permanently joined Production I.G. where he became known, together with [Hiroyuki Okiura](https://anilist.co/staff/103502/) and [Kazuchika Kise](https://anilist.co/staff/115781/), as "The Three Gods of I.G."

[Masashi Kishimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/96879/) requested for Nishio to be the character designer of the Naruto anime.

In August 2020, he was promoted to company director of Production I.G alongside [Takayuki Gotou](https://anilist.co/staff/103266/Takayuki-Gotou/), a co-founder of the studio.
Veteran animator specialized in effects animation.

**the pillows** were a Japanese alternative rock band, best known internationally for the soundtrack of the anime series FLCL. the pillows were originally "Coin Locker Babies" but was changed after Kenji left the band (KENZI&THE TRIPS).  

**Members: **
[Sawao Yamanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/172230/Sawao-Yamanaka) (Born December 7th, 1968) – vocals, rhythm guitar 
Yoshiaki Manabe (Born October 2, 1962) – lead guitar 
Shinichirou Sato (Born August 16, 1964) – drums 
Jun Suzuki – bass (support member, since 1999)  

**Former Members:** 
Kenji Ueda (Born August 30, 1965) – bass (1989–1992) 
Tatsuya Kashima – bass (support member, 1992–1999)

__[Profile (Verygoo)](http://www.verygoo.jp/artists/ron/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ron_sdf)__

__Ryuuta Iida__, also known by his stage name Ron (stylized as R・O・N) is a Japanese musician, arranger, composer, lyricist, sound producer, guitarist, keyboardist and singer. He was the sound producer and guitarist of Japanese rock band [OLDCODEX](https://anilist.co/staff/112151/OLDCODEX) along with seiyuu [Tatsuhisa Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/95735) from 2009-2012.

He currently works under the artist management company Verygoo, has a solo vocal project called [Stereo Dive Foundation](https://anilist.co/staff/118710/Stereo-Dive-Foundation), is a member of the rock band [ROSARYHILL](http://rosaryhill.net/) (2008-) as a keyboardist and vocalist, and works as a music creator for the creative music unit [(K)NoW_NAME](https://anilist.co/staff/126602/KNoW-NAME).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/高橋英樹_(アニメーター%29)

Took part as a key animator on Quentin Tarantino's "Kill Bill: Vol. 1" in 2003.

_Note: Not to be confused with either the [actor](https://anilist.co/staff/111553/) or the [mangaka](https://anilist.co/staff/110065/)._
